content: This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Symphony Lake" Singapore – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(January 2021)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)*Artificial lake in Singapore Botanic Gardens **Symphony Lake** is a [lake](/wiki/Lake) in the [Singapore Botanic Gardens](/wiki/Singapore_Botanic_Gardens), Singapore. Built in 1974, it is an [artificial lake](/wiki/Artificial_lake) and feature a large stage known as the *Shaw Foundation Symphony Stage* built in 1994 on an islet in the middle of the water body. The stage is most known as the venue for the [Singapore Symphony Orchestra](/wiki/Singapore_Symphony_Orchestra)'s monthly *SSO in the Park* open-concept [concerts](/wiki/Concert), hence giving the lake its name. Symphony Lake is located in the Central Core of Singapore Botanic Gardens. - [Swan Lake](/wiki/Swan_Lake,_Singapore) This article about a Singapore building or structure is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Symphony Lake (Singapore)
